summary.title: TMT import
summary.description: Imported from Microsoft Threat Modeling Tool .tm7 file

threats.title: Pretend to Be the Sensor 1 in Order to Exploit the Sensor Fusion ECU
threats.description: Elevation of privileges in order to exploit the Sensor Fusion ECU.

threats.title: Manipulate Sensor Fusion ECU Data in Order to Exploit a Software Parsing Vulnerability
threats.description: Elevation of privileges in order to manipulate Sensor Fusion ECU data.

threats.title: Flash Custom Firmware Onto the Sensor Fusion ECU in Order to Fully Control the Module
threats.description: Elevation of privileges in order to exploit the Sensor Fusion ECU.

threats.title: Data Flow Sniffing
threats.description: Data flowing across [Generic Data Flow] may be sniffed by an attacker. Depending on what type of data an attacker can read, it may be used to attack other parts of the system or simply be a disclosure of information leading to compliance violations. In general, as a way to compromise both integrity and availability. Severity might change depending on the attacker's access vector.

threats.title: Trick Sensor Fusion ECU Into Triggering an Emergency Stop
threats.description: Spoofing the Sensor 1 in order to trick the Sensor Fusion ECU into triggering an emergency stop.

threats.title: Manipulate the Projected Path of the Car
threats.description: Spoofing Sensor 1 data in order to manipulate the projected path of the car

threats.title: Cause the Car to Perform Emergency Braking
threats.description: Spoofing front Sensor 1 Cameras and Sensors data in order to trigger emergency braking.

threats.title: Cause the Car to Move Out of the Lane
threats.description: Spoofing Sensor 1 data in order to cause the car to move out of the lane.

threats.description: Information disclosure by downloading the updates from Truck Gateway ECU.

threats.title: Data Flow Sniffing
threats.description: Data flowing across [Generic Data Flow] may be sniffed by an attacker. Depending on what type of data an attacker can read, it may be used to attack other parts of the system or simply be a disclosure of information leading to compliance violations. In general, as a way to compromise both integrity and availability. Severity might change depending on the attacker's access vector.
